Reviews.Title: “S**thole”
Reviews.Author: Kellie E
Reviews.Content: Moved from Bluebell hotel to here . Reception staff were clueless , we had alot of problem getting key to go to the room at night as I could'nt find the receipt , Was offered a fight by one of the male member's of staff on reception who was drunk . The inside of my bin is cleaner and prettier than this hotel , our room was dirty , could pick mushrooms off the back of the bathroom floor , very cold at night just a sheet and flea ridden blanket on the bed .,

Reviews.Title: “what a hole”
Reviews.Author: nawantong
Reviews.Content: I stayed there and was given a room, shower not working and the shower floor black. the curtains were stinking, the toilet was smelling of a strange odour and belive me it stank. I was asked if I wanted a shower. This should be a basic part of the hotel set up and checked to be working properly. In the morning we went down to the basement for breakfast, no cornflakes, not cordial drink all which only cost a couple of pence to buy. I fork that was lighter than a feather. We had a choice of fried eggs on toast or scrambled eggs on toast and coffee and tea. I am ashamed to say I paid to stay in this filthy hole. It should be reported to the office of fair trading and the enviromental health association to sort these people out. I wanted to give a 0 rating but the computer would not allow this.

Reviews.Title: “worst ever nightmare, worse than a barn”
Reviews.Author: paddybroons
Reviews.Content: worse than a barn, with no toilet just a standing area for shower. Stay away from this hotel, there are a lot of nicer hotels surrounds the area with cheaper, cleaner and human-y room.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water on the top floor!”
Reviews.Author: hptrip
Reviews.Content: We were bumped off from the Whiteleaf hotel next door to here... The room we were given was on the top floor and the receptionist added "there is no hot water". I asked if that was just a temporary thing or if it was like that all the time. She said it was like that all the time to which I said that those rooms shouldn't even be sold or should be available at a discount! If you stay here make sure you get a room with hot water or to be honest the best advice I can give is to pay a bit more money an stay in a 'proper' hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A sent of the slum”
Reviews.Author: JanJohansson
Reviews.Content: Have you been dreaming of staying in a ramshackle hotel in London, itÂ´s possible : QueenÂ´s hotel, Bayswater, London. The hotel has an exelent position in Bayswater near Quensway, the tube and Hyde park. The building has a cosy facade but behind this point the slum begins. This hotel is disgusting, dirty, dangerus and unhealthy. It you whould like to research fo living in the ghetto itÂ´s O.K. The private rubbish mountain in the back-yard is an impressive home-made work of art. Hotel facilitys: Cockroaches, louse, pigeons, out of order electric radiator, draughty windows, dirty television, rude and polite service.

Reviews.Title: “Beware The Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: christallrainer
Reviews.Content: Do not visit this Hotel! ItÂ´s the worst and dirtiest place IÂ´ve ever seen in my entire life and I was a Punk Rocker when I was young! We catched at least 100 stiches of bedbugs. If you are desperate finding a place to sleep in London, better search a bridge!

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay of my life so far!”
Reviews.Author: udubjoe
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel stay of my life. Where to begin ... the first thing that we noticed was that the sink was permanently running. I asked the man running the place at the front desk (sadly, I did not catch his name, but he worked the night shift on August 11th, 2007) about what he could do. He lied to me on several occasions about what could be done. The story changed each time that I asked. We later noticed that the heater could not be turned off and that the room was permanently at a temp. approaching 80F (on a cool London night of about 55-60F). He replied that it is a UK thing that people like to have their rooms at that temperature and that it is that way in every room. Having stayed in the UK the two months leading up to this visit, I knew that he was simply continuing with his morally bankrupt manner as he was with the running sink. When I mentioned the sink again, he said that no one had actually ever complained about it before. I find it hard to believe that no one had ever complained about a sink running, that is 3 feet from your head as you sleep in a room that is 7 feet by 7 feet. The next pleasant surprise came at around 2am when the heater began making a load moaning sound. My girlfriend and had to wake up about every half hour for the rest of the night to kick the thing to make it stop. Long story short, avoid staying here at all costs. If London has anything similar to a better business bureau, this hotel should be reported and the deceitful man should be fired, fined and shunned from decent society. How he sleeps at night is a mystery, both with respect to the horrific conditions of the hotel and his complete lack of moral character. If no other place is available, as was the case in my situation, I would suggest sleeping at the Queensway Underground stop, or in a park, or on a sidewalk. At least you wouldn't have to be angered by blatant lies, unpleasant heat, and moaning noises all night. I'll risk being robbed over that any day.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful, awful.. Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: BridinBear
Reviews.Content: It is a long time since I stayed here but I feel compelled to write this review so that others can avoid the experience we had. We were in London for a wedding in August 2006 and the groom very kindly arranged accomodation for all the guests..at The Queens. When we arrived the outside looked nice enough, however the receptionist was grumpy and sour. We were made pay cash on arrival which should have been the first clue. I had to change for a wedding, however as we arrived at 11.30 we were told that I would have to change in the cubicles in the toilets. My partner put his foot down and we were grudgingly given a room on the ground floor, we had explained that we didn't mind if the room wasn't made up and would be willing to wait. On the way we passed a trolley full of linen. The room smelled of smoke, the decor was peeling and the carpet was dusty. We returned later that night after the wedding. The bed was lumpy, the numbers were missing from the room doors and it was just not clean. We didn't bother staying for breakfast for the next day as we just wanted to leave. The only good thing about the hotel is that it is located to some nice cafes and shops so we found a lovely place for breakfast, but please, do NOT go here. Friends of ours had another room and noticed that there was an active trade going on at 2am...so be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in Queen's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonymous1985
Reviews.Content: You can hear the toilet flush next door in the middle of the night. The bed is the worst you can get, no springs, dirty, etc etc. Toilets with no hot water, flow of water very very very slow. Surroundings very very dirty! Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Your worst nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Keithypie
Reviews.Content: Well, if your looking to stay in a value for money hotel in the heart of London I would strongly recommend not staying here. The door mat caked in dirt should have made the penny drop that this hotel wasn't value for money. The reception area is dirty and the clocks on the wall informed us of the time in New york, Hong Kong, Sydney etc etc. This would have been all the more informative if the actual clocks had been present. As for the room.....specks of blood all over the bed headboard, the bathroom smelled similar to a public toilet, holes in the carpet and just generally dirty. It is a truly awful hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Queen's Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 86 - 92 Inverness Terrace | Bayswater, London, England
